December 4, 1977: Fiction
THE SILMARILLION, by J.R.R. Tolkien. (Houghton Mifflin, $10.95.) Middle Earth
in pre-Hobbit days.
THE THORN BIRDS, by Colleen McCullough. (Harper & Row, $9.95.) Australian
family saga.
THE HONOURABLE SCHOOLBOY, by John le Carr√©. (Knopf, $10.) Espionage in
Hong Kong.
DANIEL MARTIN, by John Fowles. (Little, Brown, $12.95.) English screenwriter
reviews his life.
BEGGARMAN, THIEF, by Irwin Shaw. (Delacorte, $9.95.) The next generation of
Jordaches takes over.
DREAMS DIE FIRST, by Harold Robbins. (Simon & Schuster, $9.95.) Hustler-type
girlie magazine publisher.
ILLUSIONS, by Richard Bach. (Delacorte/Eleanor Friede, $5.95.) Messiah
barnstorms Middle America.
THE IMMIGRANTS, by Howard Fast. (Houghton Mifflin, $6.95.) Ambition and love
in turn-of-the-century San Francisco.
THE BOOK OF MERLYN, by Terence H. White. (University of Texas Press,
$9.95.) Missing book of "The Once and Future King."
THE SECOND DEADLY SIN, by Lawrence Sanders. (Putnam's, $9.95.) Cop
tracks down a painter's murderer.
DELTA OF VENUS, by Anais Nin. (Harcourt Brace Jovanovich, $10.) Elegant
erotica written for a wealthy patron.
DYNASTY, by Robert S. Elegant. (McGraw-Hill, $10.95.) Saga of a Eurasian
family in Hong Kong over three generations.
THE WOMEN'S ROOM, by Marilyn French. (Summit Books, $10.95.) Woman's
rough road to liberation.
THE INVESTIGATION, by Dorothy Uhnak. (Simon & Schuster, $9.95.) Woman
accused of murdering her children.
TRUE CONFESSIONS, by John Gregory Dunne. (E.P. Dutton, $9.95.)
Contemporary hardboiled detective thriller.
December 4, 1977
Non-Fiction
ALL THINGS WISE AND WONDERFUL, by James Herriot. (St. Martin's Press,
$10.) More adventures of a Yorkshire vet.
THE BOOK OF LISTS, by David Wallechhinsky, Irving Wallace and Amy Wallace.
(Morrow, $10.95.) Facts that entertain.
LOOKING OUT FOR NUMBER ONE, by Robert Ringer. (Cromwell, $9.95.) How
to get yours.
GNOMES, text by Wil Huygen, illustrated by Rien Poortvliet. (Harry N. Abrams,
$14.95.) Everything you wanted to know about the little people.
THE COMPLETE BOOK OF RUNNING, by James F. Fixx. (Random House, $10.)
For fun and health.
THE AMITYVILLE HORROR, by Jay Anson. (Prentice-Hall, $7.95.) Haunted
house in suburbia.
SIX MEN, by Allistair Cooke. (Knopf, $8.95.) Profiles of public men he knew.
DESIGNING YOUR FACE, by Way Bandy. (Random House, $8.95.) How to use
cosmetics.
THE DRAGONS OF EDEN, by Carl Sagan. (Random House, $8.95.) How human
intelligence evolved: a scientist's speculation.
THE WOMAN'S DRESS FOR SUCCESS BOOK, by John Malloy. (Follett, $9.95.)
Female guide to tasteful apparel.
THE COUNTRY DIARY OF AN EDWARDIAN LADY, by Edith Holden. (Holt,
$14.95.) Record kept by a nature lover and illustrator.
LIFE IS A BANQUET, by Rosalind Russell, with Chris Chase . (Random House,
$10.) Memoirs of the late actress,
ESSAYS OF E.B. WHITE, by E.B. White. (Harper & Row, $12.50.) Observations
on things large and small.
ORIGINS, by Richard E. Leakey and Roger Lewin. (Dutton, $17.95.) Early
mankind - the scientific view.
THE CAMERA NEVER BLINKS, by Dan Rather with Mickey Herskowitz. (Morrow,
$10.) TV newsman's story.
